Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: Draw a basic outline of a plant, but with limited detail or accuracy (the plant might include just a stem and one or two leaves).
Show sporadic and unclear differences between two plants, possibly using inconsistent sizes or an ambiguous attempt to indicate one is 'different' from the other without clarity.
CANNOT: Clearly depict which plant is healthy with water and which is unhealthy without water (student might draw both plants looking similar regardless of their water status).
Illustrate a clear difference in appearance between plants with plenty of water and those without (student doesn't know this, might represent both as identical or with random elements).
Show how a plant changes over time without water (student may not indicate time or change at all).
Represent the importance of water for plant life through contrasts in their drawings (student might not understand water's role, leading to no clear contrasts).
